channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: The week ahead: May 31
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe UK throws Elizabeth II a party. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Ukraine war milestone: Saturday will mark 100 days since Russia first invaded Ukraine. The Boston Celtics and the Golden State Warriors will face off in the NBA Finals beginning on Thursday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Mona Lisa smeared with cake in apparent climate protest
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Good news is that Leonardo da Vinci’s masterpiece, probably the most recognizable painting in the world, was not damaged by the caking. A man who disguised himself as an elderly woman in a wheelchair smeared cake on the iconic painting’s glass case at the Louvre yesterday in what appeared to be a climate protest. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe “Mona Lisa” is protected by bulletproof glass, and yesterday we found out that it’s properly shielded against cake, too. Big picture: Something about the “Mona Lisa” gets people riled up, and yesterday’s attack was not the first time the portrait’s been messed with…It was stolen by three Italian handymen in 1911, which actually helped boost its status.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Pools, restaurants brace for another summer of worker shortages
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On the one hand, Americans are basically done with home-cooked meals. Given the shortage of workers in other age cohorts, more teens are working now than they have since the 2008–09 financial crisis. Even after dangling a $2,500 incentive, the city can’t find enough staff. And a lack of lifeguards could prevent one-third of the 300,000+ public pools in the US from opening this summer, the American Lifeguard Association warned. How to explain it?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Crypto money is shaking up US politics
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. So how is SBF spending his money? On a podcast this week, Bankman-Fried (nicknamed SBF) said that he expects to give at least $100 million in political donations for the upcoming 2024 election, and could spend up to $1 billion if Donald Trump were a factor. )Some think that SBF has other motives with his political giving. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Make it work: How should I utilize a mentor?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In fact, one of the ways I would look to utilize this mentor is to gain access to the people that they know. The key to figuring out how to utilize a mentor starts with understanding a mentor’s purpose. In order to best utilize your mentor, you’ll want to 1) make sure they know what problems you’re running into 2) have some level of visibility into your work and 3) have insight into your short- and long-term goals. Most were not officially assigned and, sadly, none were actually named Mentor.
item.author: Shane Loughnane

item.title: Icebreakers with…Tyler Cowen and Daniel Gross, authors of Talent
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Then they hired Allen Klein, which led to great discord within the group and damaged their financial affairs. There are also biases when men interview women, at least on average. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. More generally, many interviewers are trying too hard to look for people who are a lot like them. To help us become better talent spotters in a world where spotting talent is increasingly important, economist Tyler Cowen and venture capitalist and entrepreneur Daniel Gross wrote a book on the art and science of finding talent at the highest level. Many highly successful individuals are terrible at talent assessment. This interview has been condensed.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Stock watch: May 29
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Here’s what the ‘Planes, Trains and Automobiles’ trip would cost today
item.description: . Here’s our pricing breakdown, in case you’re thinking of reliving the worst weekend of all time:A 6:00pm first-class flight from LGA to O’Hare before a holiday weekend: ~$400Midtown Manhattan car (let’s say Uber) to LGA: ~$85 (x2 since Del steals the first)Uber to a hotel after being diverted to Wichita: ~$25Last-minute hotel in Wichita: ~$100 a nightAmtrak from Kansas City (closest available location) to Chicago: ~$200 (x2)Bus from Jefferson City to St. Louis (once the train breaks down): ~$30 (x2)Rental car in St. Louis: likely unavailable, but ~$210 (x2 since movie Neal’s car is missing)Illinois hotel: ~$150Chicago L train: $2.50 (x2)Not included: gas, a speeding ticket, a robbery, or the cost of their destroyed rental car. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —MK
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Camping is holding on to its pandemic popularity in 2022
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. 33% more people are shopping on Amazon for camping tents this year compared to 2019, and demand for other outdoor gear (lanterns, backpacks, camp stoves) has also risen by double digits, per data analytics company Pattern. —JW Zoom out: Getaway’s Chief Experience Officer Carlos Becil told the Brew via a spokesperson, “Between inflation, the stock market, and recession fears, people have a strong desire to find ways to disconnect from the stress and spend time in nature to help them reconnect with themselves, and their loved ones.” css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Brew readers share their travel hot takes
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. ? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Curated playlist: 54%Podcast: 20%Audiobook: 12%No aux needed—road trips are for the local radio stations: 10%Nothing, I prefer silence: 4%Do you use cruise control on the highway?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Hospitality industry evolves to accommodate a surge in pet travel
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But this is pet owners we’re talking about here—so a bustling luxury pet travel market has also sprung up. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeWhen we first announced we were publishing a travel newsletter, requests flooded in around one topic specifically: traveling with pets. While road tripping with your pet has likely never been easier, flying with one has gotten a lot more complicated and restrictive during Covid. The surge in pet-related travel amenities appears to be yet another one of those simmering trends that the pandemic sent boiling. Lists of the best pet carriers for travel (CNN, HuffPost)Two websites that help you find pet-friendly accommodation. Big picture: The best pet-friendly vacation might be one that’s not too far away. Pet-friendly travel is one of the hottest trends in the industry. Nearly one in five households (~23 million Americans) acquired a cat or dog since the beginning of the Covid outbreak, the ASPCA reported last year. A Santa Barbara hotel, El Encanto, offers a gourmet dog menu with seasonal fish for $15/plate, followed by an herbal tea blend at $5/bowl.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The best weekend getaways in the US, as recommended by Morning Brew readers
item.description: . Newport, RI for the mansions, of course. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. ) Inniswood Metro Gardens just 20 minutes north of downtown Columbus. Mackinac Island in Lake HuronHolland, MI, for breweries and lake views. Lake Winnipesaukee, the largest lake in New Hampshire. Onfokus/Getty ImagesBig Bear Lake in San Bernardino National Forest. Point Reyes National SeashoreCalistoga, a tiny town in Napa Valley with the Old Faithful Geyser of California. Ojai, a small city in a valley in the Topatopa Mountains. Just southwest of LA, the resort town on Catalina Island. Montauk on the east end of Long Island. Reno, NV, known as “The Biggest Little City in the World.” Michel Arnaud/Getty ImagesFredericksburg, TX, is known for its wineries and is located about two hours west of AustinDinosaur Valley State Park, an hour southwest of Fort Worth. Asbury Park, a bustling seaside town on the Jersey Shore. Gaul/Getty ImagesHighlands, NC, a town in the Nantahala National Forest at an elevation of 4,118 feet. The weird West Texas town of Marfa.
item.author: Neal Freyman

Big picture: The best pet-friendly vacation might be one that’s not too far away. Pet-friendly travel is one of the hottest trends in the industry. Lists of the best pet carriers for travel (CNN, HuffPost)Two websites that help you find pet-friendly accommodation. Nearly one in five households (~23 million Americans) acquired a cat or dog since the beginning of the Covid outbreak, the ASPCA reported last year. The surge in pet-related travel amenities appears to be yet another one of those simmering trends that the pandemic sent boiling. Metropolitan at the 9 in Cleveland has an indoor dog park. And finally, here are some resources to help you plan the perfect pet vacation. You can get a facial and nail care done alongside your dog at the Lygon Arms in England’s Cotswolds for about $218. This presents a new group of customers to be won, and many hotels are racing to offer the friendliest pet accommodations around.

item.title: Analysts think ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ will be Tom Cruise’s biggest opening ever
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. For Hollywood, Top Gun: Maverick is a throwback to a film industry built on star power, practical effects, and spectacle (as opposed to the raw sex appeal of Paddington that dominates today’s box office). Like audiences, movie studios aren’t exactly rushing back into theaters.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: The global helium shortage is getting serious
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The university said it isn’t providing balloons to fans due to a helium shortage. Zoom out: In FY 2013, helium cost about $65 per thousand cubic feet. Because of the global helium shortage, the National Weather Service warned that it would need to reduce the frequency of weather balloon launches, according to Axios.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Sequoia Capital warns of a “Crucible Moment” for startups
item.description: . Silicon Valley startup incubator Y Combinator sent an email to its founders with a Game of Thrones season one vibe. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It’s one of at least 16 tech companies that let more than 7,200 employees go this week. These days, it’s not the only one sounding the alarm for startups. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. The tech rout isn’t just cyclical—it’s well-earned, and overdue. (Bloomberg)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Brew's summer '22 reading list
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Freezing Order reads like a thriller, but it’s the true story of how Russia ended up interfering in the 2016 US presidential election. Order these books so your summer reading is sitting on your porch when you get back on Monday. Read the novel so you can be that person who says the book was better. How many more times can you go through Harry Styles’s new album? css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. item.author: Rohan Anthony

item.title: Apple’s self-repair program disappoints right-to-repair advocates
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The backstory: Last month, Apple launched its Self Service Repair Store, which allows customers to buy parts for select Apple devices they can repair at home. Apple said in a white paper last month, “For the vast majority of customers, the safest and most reliable repair is achieved through an Apple Store. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Bottom line: Critics say Apple doesn’t want customers to repair their phones at home, and, when this program proves to be unpopular, will use it as evidence against right-to-repair initiatives.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Chelsea FC is latest English soccer club to be gobbled up by American investors
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIt’s one of our favorite conversation starters: If you’re a rich American investor looking to buy a sports franchise, which league would you choose? Chelsea joins a growing list of Premier League clubs backed by American money. For real moguls and not just wannabes like us, that answer is increasingly the English Premier League.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: After the Texas elementary school shooting, what comes next?
item.description: . The gunman in Tuesday’s massacre legally purchased two AR platform rifles in the days following his 18th birthday last week. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One potential road to compromise: “Red flag” legislation, or laws that would allow authorities to temporarily take guns away from individuals who are deemed a threat to themselves or others. Texas has among the least restrictive gun laws in the US, and lawmakers have actually relaxed them in the state over the past few years, according to the Texas Tribune. And at the federal level, gun reform is effectively frozenSenate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer added votes on two background check bills to the chamber’s calendar, both of which would expand checks for sales at gun shows and online. Democratic lawmakers renewed their calls for gun legislation, but were once again confronted with the fact that the numbers for enacting policy are stacked against them due to Republican opposition. Even with a slight majority in the House, Democrats are evenly split in the Senate and would need 10 Republicans to vote alongside them there. —MM They don’t think access to guns contributes to mass shootings. Other links to stay up to date about the shootingMeta said the gunman discussed his planned attack in private messages on Facebook about 30 minutes before the shooting. “The time to stop the next shooting is now, and you are doing nothing,” O’Rourke said. Alabama Sen. Tommy Tuberville said yesterday that “Guns are not the problem. For instance, In 2013, the bipartisan duo of Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin and Republican Sen. Pat Toomey introduced a compromise bill that would require background checks for commercial sales of guns.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: After the Texas elementary school shooting, what comes next?
item.description: . The gunman in Tuesday’s massacre legally purchased two AR platform rifles in the days following his 18th birthday last week. Historically, mass shootings haven’t led to much action from American lawmakers. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One potential road to compromise: “Red flag” legislation, or laws that would allow authorities to temporarily take guns away from individuals who are deemed a threat to themselves or others. But gun laws have been loosened in the state in the past few years, reports the Texas Tribune. That includes a permitless carry bill passed, the Second Amendment Sanctuary Act (which means local agencies can’t enforce new federal gun laws), and a law that allows individuals as young as 18 to buy a handgun all passed last year. —MM Democrats could also try to change filibuster rules and allow a simple majority to pass gun reform, but Democratic Senators Joe Manchin and Kyrsten Sinema have vocally opposed messing with the rules. And currently, even with a slight majority in the House, Democrats are evenly split in the Senate and would need 10 Republicans to vote alongside them there. And don’t expect immediate action at the federal levelSenate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer added votes on two background check bills to the chamber’s calendar, both of which would expand checks for sales at gun shows and online. “The time to stop the next shooting is now, and you are doing nothing,” O’Rourke said. Other links to stay up to date about the shootingMeta said the gunman discussed his planned attack in private messages on Facebook about 30 minutes before the shooting.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Hey, Miso Robot—can I get fries with that?
item.description: That’s what the future of quick-service restaurants (QSR) could look like with Miso Robotics. When it’s combined, you see a robot doing the work of roughly two people during peak periods in a quiet, seamless, and very efficient way. We're not just going to wake up one day, and there’ll be 1.5 million new workers happily jumping into the restaurant industry. We really see ourselves as a solution to the labor crisis in the quick serve restaurant industry. from our sponsorFired up about Flippy and its robot siblings? When someone sees Flippy taking frozen fries all the way through to the cook station and serving cooked fries, you can kinda just drop the mic. What do you see Miso’s role in the restaurant industry? And the automation guy is saying, “I think that the technology has now evolved in such a way that it’s approachable and affordable today for a robot to take over some of the tasks.” What Flippy does is simple: It takes frozen fries all the way through the fry process and dispenses cooked fries. Yeah, so if you look at fast-food restaurants, fries go with almost every order. Miso is still open to investors as they take on the $300B US Quick Serve Restaurant Industry. I was talking to some of the workers who have had one of our Flippy units installed for the longest period of time. Our mission is to automate restaurants, and we’re starting with automating fry stations. Where did the idea for the Flippy come from?
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: Flowcarbon raises $70 million to tokenize carbon offsets
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe blockchain startup Flowcarbon landed $70 million in its first round of funding, led by Andreessen Horowitz’s crypto division. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Flowcarbon wants to cut middlemen out of the process by turning carbon credits into tokens (its first is called GNT, for “goddess nature token”) that can be bought and sold on the blockchain. As it stands, carbon credits can be bought through private companies or through carbon exchanges. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Flowcarbon was co-founded by former WeWork CEO Adam Neumann, but this time he’s looking to solve a more complicated problem than infusing all office water with fruit: managing carbon offsets.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: 40% of recent job switchers are looking for a new job again
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. That being said, job switching continues to be one of the best ways to boost your stats on celebritynetworth. New research into the American job market shows that many people who recently quit their job for another one are pretty quickly itching to quit the new job, too. LinkedIn data backs that up: The company found that the share of job switchers who’d been at their previous job for less than 12 months rose by 6.5% in 2021 compared to 2020. —MK And, per the Grant Thornton survey, 40% of workers who took a new job reported a pay increase of at least 10%, more than double all other survey respondents. But 40% of that group is actively looking for another job, compared to 29% of all full-time employees—revealing some significant buyer’s remorse among job jumpers.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: At least 21 killed in elementary school shooting in Texas
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Big picture: Guns surpassed car accidents as the No. 1 cause of death among children in 2020, jumping nearly 30% between 2019 and 2020, per a research letter in the New England Journal of Medicine. Yesterday’s shooting in Texas was the 27th school shooting this year, which means one has occurred roughly every five days in 2022. It was also just one of several mass shootings across the country in the past couple weeks. Republican Senator Ted Cruz of Texas called the shooting “truly horrific,” but rejected Dems’ calls for gun reform and instead proposed stepped-up security at schools. Laguna Woods, CA: A day after the Buffalo shooting, a man was killed and four others wounded at a shooting at a Taiwanese church.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. item.title: Flowcarbon raises $70 million to tokenize carbon offsets
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe blockchain startup Flowcarbon landed $70 million in its first round of funding, led by Andreessen Horowitz’s crypto division. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. As it stands, carbon credits can be bought through private companies or through carbon exchanges. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Flowcarbon wants to cut middlemen out of the process by turning carbon credits into tokens (its first is called GNT, for “goddess nature token”) that can be bought and sold on the blockchain. For example, General Motors buys carbon offsets to counter tailpipe emissions. Flowcarbon was co-founded by former WeWork CEO Adam Neumann, but this time he’s looking to solve a more complicated problem than infusing all office water with fruit: managing carbon offsets.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: 40% of recent job switchers are looking for a new job again
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. New research into the American job market shows that many people who recently quit their job for another one are pretty quickly itching to ditch it. That being said, job switching continues to be one of the best ways to boost your stats on celebritynetworth. LinkedIn data backs that up: The company found that the share of job switchers who’d been at their previous job for less than 12 months rose by 6.5% in 2021 compared to 2020. —MK And, per the Grant Thornton survey, 40% of workers who took a new job reported a pay increase of at least 10%, more than double all other survey respondents. But 40% of that group is actively looking for another job, compared to 29% of all full-time employees—revealing some significant buyer’s remorse among job jumpers.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: SiriusXM acquires Conan O’Brien’s Team Coco network for $150 million
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The podcast ad market topped $1.4 billion in revenue in 2021 and is projected to exceed $4 billion by 2024. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeComedy tall-guy Conan O’Brien has sold his digital media company, Team Coco, to SiriusXM in a heavyweight deal valued around $150 million. —MK Zoom out: The nine-figure acquisition—Sirius’s largest in the podcaster space—comes two years after Spotify’s reported $200 million deal with Joe Rogan, although Conan’s show features fewer convos about ice baths and DMT. O’Brien himself signed a five-year talent agreement and will produce a comedy channel for the satellite radio company. Under the deal, Conan O’Brien Needs a Friend, Team Coco’s flagship podcast, will make the leap to SiriusXM’s pod network along with Team Coco’s network of 10 podcasts including Rob Lowe’s Parks and Recollection and Nicole Byer’s Why Won’t You Date Me? Team Coco’s staff of about 50 employees will join Sirius. Conan O’Brien Needs a Friend ranked 26th among all podcasts by weekly listeners in Q1.
item.author: Max Knoblauch
